verses.verse: For we know that if our earthly house, our tent, is destroyed, we have a building of God, a house not made with hands, eternal in the heavens.
For we groan at this, so longing to be clothed with our house which is from heaven.
So if being clothed, we will not be found naked.
For we who are still in this tent, groan, being burdened, not because we prefer to be unclothed but rather clothed, so that what's dying may be swallowed up by life.
Now he who has worked on us for that very thing is God, who has also given to us the surety of the Spirit.
Therefore we can always be confident that while we are at home in the body, we are absent from the Lord
(for we walk by faith, not by sight).
We are confident and think [it is] good to be absent from the body and to be at home with the Lord.
And so we make it our goal to please Him whether we are at home or away from home.
For all of us must appear before the Judgment Seat of Christ, in order that every one may get the things [they've done] through their body according to what they did whether good or bad.
Therefore knowing the fear of the Lord, we persuade men, but we are transparent to God, and I trust are also transparent to your conscientiousness.
We don't promote ourselves again to you but give you a opportunity to be proud of us so that you may have something to respond to those who place importance on appearance instead of the heart.
So what if we are crazy, [it is] for God, but if we're sane, it is for you.
For Christ's love compels us, because we have concluded that if one died for all then all have died.
And he died for all, so that those who live wouldn't live for themselves but for him who died for them and rose again.
So then now we acknowledge no man according to the flesh. Yes, even though we have known Christ according to the flesh, yet now we don't know [Him this way] any more.
Therefore in anyone is in Christ, [he is] a new creation; the old things are gone, [and] look, the new things have come.
All this is from God, who has reconciled us, through Christ and has given us the ministry of reconciliation.
That is because God was in Christ, reconciling the world to himself, not reckoning their sins to them, and He has committed the message of reconciliation to us.
So then we are ambassadors for Christ, in this sense God making an appeal through us; we beg of you on the behalf of Christ, "Be reconciled to God."
For he has made him, who knew no sin, "sin" for us, so that we might become God's righteousness in Him.
